Key Match Events: Hong Kong lost 3-1 to the United Arab Emirates in their opening match on Sunday but the 32-year-old forward set up their goal and the lowest-ranked team in Qatar are still alive in the tournament.
Pre-Game Insights: Everton Camargo admits he would be playing lower-league football if he had stayed in Brazil, so he switched to Hong Kong and is their danger man at their first Asian Cup in more than half a century.
Everton says the team have 'improved a lot in the last two years, perhaps also with the arrival of foreigners to help the Hong Kong team along with the local, Chinese players'.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Hong Kong face Iran, one of the Asian Cup favourites, on Friday and are also grouped with Palestine.

They are not expected to reach the next round but they won 2-1 against China in a friendly behind closed doors in the build-up to the competition, a first victory over their mainland rivals in 29 years.
Others: Everton Camargo is a quick and strong right-sided forward, always looking to cut inside and work a shot on his left, in a style he likens to Netherlands great Arjen Robben or Liverpool star Mohamed Salah.
Hong Kong's Norwegian coach Jorn Andersen says Everton is'maybe the best player in Hong Kong'.
